item.title: First Steps with RxJS
item.description: An introduction to RxJS, a library for reactive programming in JavaScript/TypeScript. We’ll cover core concepts like observables, operators, testing, and tips for managing asynchronous data flows.
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: Uncovering some of the merits of text-based diagrams
item.description: Every once in a short while, new digital technology comes out to iterate on existing products. Software targeting technical design (e.g., flowcharts) is no exception. Yet, there is still room to enjoy older tools that work simply… and simply work!
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: A Guided Tour of an i3 Configuration
item.description: This article will go over my dear i3 configuration file, which contains quite a few sections I hope I had stumbled upon right from the start when I got introduced to the tiling window manager world. It would probably have been less scary and intimidating. May you find the shortcut you needed!
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: My Current Set of Tools and Customizations
item.description: I like to keep track of the tools I use and see the shifts that occur over time — may it be switching from a graphical interface to a command-line one or finding a totally new workflow for an existing need. Without further ado, here’s the list!
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: Tip the Scales in Times of Instability With the Rock-Solid Debian
item.description: Desperate times call for the best Linux experience possible… And in my experience so far, the Debian distribution with the Xfce desktop environment or with the even lighter alternative i3 tiling window manager makes for a very smooth ride.
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: Suckless: Minimalist Tools That Work Great
item.description: I have been using a few different tools from suckless.org for a while and I must say that once everything is configured properly, they are a joy to use. Some tools, like dmenu and slock, seem simple on the surface, but they allow to simplify your workflow by quite a bit. Another one, st, is a truly fantastic and lightweight terminal!
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie

item.title: Surfing with qutebrowser — a Keyboard-Driven Web Browser
item.description: I recently started using this software as my main web browser and, as a Vim (Neovim) user, I must say I am finding the adventure quite compelling!
item.dc:creator: Sébastien Lavoie
